name: bathypelagic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the part of the ocean that is between approximately 2000 feet (600 metres) and 12,000 feet (3,600 metres) deep: The bathypelagic zone lies below the mesopelagic zone and above the abyssal pelagic zone, and includes the water that overlies the continental slope. The bathypelagic realm of the ocean is believed to be home to organisms that have yet to be studied by man.
More examplesFewer examplesBathypelagic fish tend not to move around as actively as those living in higher zones, opting instead to lie in wait for their prey.
